net.sourceforge.aglets.itinerary.helpers
Class BaseItinerary

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.aglets.itinerary.helpers.BaseItinerary
All Implemented Interfaces:
Itinerary, SimpleItinerary
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseCircularItinerary, BaseRandomItinerary, BaseTaskItinerary
public class BaseItinerary
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimpleItinerary

This class represents the base class for more complex itinerary. It provides the storing mechanism for locations and provides method implementations. Extends this class and override apt methods to produce the itinerary logic you want. Please note that this class does not provide synchronized methods, since a single itinerary object is not supposed to be shared between several concurrent entities. If you need to share the itinerary you should provide synchronization by your own or use the syncrhonized itinerary facilities.
Attention: this itinerary does not allow duplicated destination, that means if you try to insert more than once the same destination, only the first insert will be successful.

Version:
1.0 13-set-2005
Author:
Luca Ferrari - cat4hire@users.sourceforge.net

Field Detail

agletOwner

protected Aglet agletOwner
The agent owning this itinerary. An agent is owning this itinerary if it will use the itinerary. The itinerary will act on the owning agent.

Constructor Detail

BaseItinerary

public BaseItinerary(Aglet owner,
                     int baseSize)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Default constructor for this itinerary. It requires the agent that is owning this itinerary in order to know which agent needs to be moved once the itinerary methods are called.

Parameters:
owner - the agent owner of this itinerary, that is the agent is creating and using this itinerary.
baseSize - the initial dimension of the itinerary list, used to create the vector with the appropriate size. If an invalid size is provided (i.e., baseSize <= 0), the standard value of 10 is adopted.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the owner is null.

BaseItinerary

public BaseItinerary(Aglet owner)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Overriden constructor, initializes the itinerary with the owning aglet.

Parameters:
owner - the aglet that owns (i.e., will use) this itinerary.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the owner is null.

BaseItinerary

public BaseItinerary(Itinerary oldItinerary,
                     Aglet owner)
Constructs an itinerary starting from another itinerary.

Parameters:
oldItinerary - the itinerary to use as base for this one.
owner - the agent that must own this itinerary.
Method Detail

addNextDestination

public boolean addNextDestination(java.lang.String destinationURI)
Adds a new destination at the end of the destination list of this itinerary. The destination is not added in the case it is null or a void string.

Specified by:
addNextDestination in interface SimpleItinerary
Parameters:
destinationURI - the destination to add.
Returns:
true if the destination is added, false otherwise.

addNextDestination

public boolean addNextDestination(java.lang.String destinationURI,
                                  int index)
Adds the specified destination at the specified position in the destination list. ATTENTION: since this itinerary implementation is based on a Vector, inserting the destination at the specified position could raise an ArrayIndexOutOfBound exception, since the position could exceed the vector size. To avoid this, there is a check on the position to avoid inserting in position less than zero or greater than the size of vector.

Specified by:
addNextDestination in interface SimpleItinerary
Parameters:
destinationURI - the destination to add.
index - the index (position) where the destinationURI should be inserted.
Returns:
true if the destination is added, false otherwise

addNextDestination

public boolean addNextDestination(java.lang.String destinationURI,
                                  java.lang.String previousDestinationURI)
Adds a destination just after the previous one as specified. If the previous destination is not contained in the itinerary, it is first added as the last one, and then the following destination is added.

Specified by:
addNextDestination in interface SimpleItinerary
Parameters:
destinationURI - the destination to add. #param previousDestinationURI the destination that must be visited before the one is going to be added.
previousDestinationURI - the destination that must be previous the one added.
Returns:
true if the destination is inserted, false otherwise

addNextDestinationIfNotDuplicated

public boolean addNextDestinationIfNotDuplicated(java.lang.String destinationURI)
Adds a destination only if it is not already contained in this itinerary.

Specified by:
addNextDestinationIfNotDuplicated in interface SimpleItinerary
Parameters:
destinationURI - the destination to add
Returns:
true if the destination has been added, false otherwise

removeDestinationAt

public boolean removeDestinationAt(int index)
Removes the destination at the specified index. The index must be valid, that is greater than 0 and less than the max size of the destination lists.

Specified by:

Gets the list of destinations.

getDestinations in interface Itinerary
Returns:

setImmutable

public final void setImmutable()
This method sets the itinerary as frozen, that means no more add/delete operation can be performed on this itinerary (if you want to modify the itinerary you have to create a new one). This method is useful when there's the risk that the itinerary is changed multiple times (e.g., due to a message handling).

Specified by:
setImmutable in interface Itinerary

isMmutable

protected final boolean isMmutable()
A method to test the state of this itinerary.

Returns:
true if the itinerary is mutable (add/delete operations are allowed), false otherwise.

goToNextDestination

public void goToNextDestination()
Forces the migration to the next destination. If the migration is not possible, the stacktrace and the exception are printed, but the agent is not required to handle the exception. Please note that once the agent has visited all the destinations, the execution of this method will have no effect.

Specified by:
goToNextDestination in interface Itinerary
